creator: mmists
title: Mesmerizing Video Feedback Mandala
materials_required: Video Monitor with Brightness and Contrast controls
description: This project guides you through creating a mesmerizing, generative video mandala using a camera and a monitor by exploiting the feedback loop between the two. It also shows you how to modify the mandala using lenses, masks, and video effects.
steps: Gather the required equipment: a video monitor with brightness and contrast controls, a video camera, a tripod, and a video cable to connect the camera to the monitor.

Set up the monitor on a sturdy table, ensuring it is powered on. Mount the camera to the tripod and position it approximately three feet away from the monitor, aligning the camera lens with the center of the screen. Connect the video cable from the camera's output to the monitor's input.

Establish a feedback loop by turning on the camera and monitor. Experiment with the zoom controls on the camera and adjust the distance and angle of the tripod. Adjust the brightness and contrast to achieve a clear image. If no image appears, verify the lens cap is removed, the controls are at their default positions, and the cable is correctly connected. Address dimness or scan lines by adjusting the monitor's brightness/contrast and the camera's exposure level, respectively.

Tilt the camera approximately 20 degrees to the left. Observe the mirrored rotation of the image on the screen. Experiment with zoom/distance and the camera's angle to alter the image. Center the image on the screen by adjusting the tripod's height and left/right position, moving slowly and incrementally due to the reversed perspective.

Fine-tune the image using the monitor's brightness and contrast controls until a balanced, stable image is achieved. If the image disappears, introduce a light source in the background. Experiment with other available controls like Tint and Color, adjusting one parameter at a time.

Introduce external elements to influence the image, such as lenses, prisms, or masks placed between the camera and the screen. Incorporate video effects using outboard boxes or the camera's built-in effects. To record, add a recording device like a VCR into the signal path.

creator: mmists
title: Mesmerizing Video Feedback Mandala
description: This project creates a mesmerizing, generative video mandala using only a camera and a monitor through a feedback loop. The image on the screen is created with nothing more than the feedback between the camera and monitor. Modifiers like lenses, masks, or video effects can be introduced to make more interesting and varied mandalas.
steps: Gather a video monitor with brightness/contrast controls, a video camera, a tripod, and a video cable.

Set up the monitor on a table, plug in the power, mount the camera to the tripod, and place it in front of the monitor about three feet away. Ensure the camera lens is level with the center of the screen and connect the video cable from the camera's output to the monitor's input. Dark room is ideal.

Turn on the camera and monitor to establish a feedback loop. Experiment with zoom controls and move the tripod closer or further from the monitor. Adjust brightness and contrast until an image appears on the screen. Remove the lens cap and check the connections if there is no image

Tilt the camera about 20 degrees to the left to add a twist to the image. Adjust zoom/distance and angle to observe the effects. Center the image by adjusting the tripod's height and left/right position.

Fine-tune the image using the monitor's brightness and contrast controls to find a balanced, stable image. Introduce a light source if the image disappears. Experiment with other available controls such as tint and color.

Introduce external elements like lenses, prisms, or cardboard masks to influence the image. Add video effects or recording device for recording the results. Explore video feedback resources for further information.
